column4: I am having touble with my hal, it fails to initialized ( I get a popup on login saying so) and now I can't use my dvdroms and my usb sticks, ipod and other usb stuff
did you disable something from your System -> Pref ->session?session
don't hink so I will check
no everything is on but bluetooth and I don't have bluetooth
For me Disabling blue tooth did it. you can disable it totally by installing sysv-rc-conf I can find a how to for you if you need it
will it hurt if I leave it on?
in short there's still a daemon running that wants to find the applet, thats why HAL is crashing..
nah won't hurt you, may just eat a few ms out of sturt up but thats all
then how do I remove it cuz I have a server on here I neede
I will log out and back in with bluethooth on
if you want to disable it completely you can "sudo apt-get install sysv-rc-conf" then "sudo sysv-rc-conf" in terminal, from there just scroll to the bluetooth section,
no problem, I cut my boot time down to about 45s using this.
